header.title: Banishing The Slave Gods
header.category: Western Esotericism, Chaos Magic, Magical Practice

central_thesis: The core thesis is to engage in an 'offensive in the battle against the Slave Gods' by employing specific magical practices, primarily a combination of Thelemic banishing/invocation rites and a sex magical rite designed to open the practitioner's and target's 'third eye,' thereby projecting influence (curse/blessing) and initiating others towards 'illumination' by disrupting their perceived 'Borg God' enslavement.

structure_content.summary: The author outlines their approach to 'offensive magic' against 'Slave Gods' and provides preliminary recommendations for foundational magical training, specifically citing Peter Carroll's Liber MMM and Aleister Crowley's Magick : Liber Aba : Book 4.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Star Ruby Rite and Pentagram Projection
structure_content.summary: This section details the daily practice of Crowley's Star Ruby as both a banishing and invocation rite, suggesting 'Hail Satan' as a substitute for 'Io Pan'. Crucially, it introduces the visualization and projection of an inverse pentagram from the practitioner's forehead to the target's forehead for 'offensive attack' (curse/blessing), linking its efficacy to the practitioner's 'third eye chakra'.

structure_content.chapter_title: Sex Magical Rite for Third Eye Activation
structure_content.summary: A specific sex magical ritual is described for opening the 'third eye'. It involves solitary masturbation (or partnered anal intercourse) while focusing on the Tower and Devil Tarot cards, employing 'karezza' (prolonged arousal without orgasm) to build energy. The practitioner is instructed to assume the 'Head of the Goat' and project the pentagram from their 'third eye', with an option to charge a sigil with semen.

The ultimate purpose of these rites is clarified: to create a psychic link with the target, activate their 'third eye chakra,' raise their energy, and initiate them 'via shaktipat' towards 'illumination'. This 'Black' magic is framed as causing change to a 'weaker will' enslaved by a 'Borg God,' implicitly freeing them.

key_concepts.definition: Externalized deities, belief systems, or dogmatic structures perceived as enslaving individuals, which the practitioner actively opposes through magic.

A proactive magical intervention aimed at targets, framed by the author as a 'blessing in disguise' because it is intended to disrupt their 'enslavement' and initiate them towards 'illumination' rather than pure harm.
An energy center (Ajna chakra) located between the eyebrows, critical for psychic perception and the projection of magical force and symbols, central to the efficacy of the described rites.
A five-pointed star with one point downwards, used as a symbol for aggressive magical projection, visualized and projected from the practitioner's forehead onto a target's forehead.
A sexual practice involving prolonged arousal and avoiding climax, used in the sex magical rite to build and channel energetic force for magical intent without physical discharge.
Reinterpreted here as the 'quickening of the energies' in a target through magical projection, aiming to activate their 'third eye' and facilitate their initiation towards illumination.
A metaphor for a collective, assimilating, and controlling divine or ideological entity that 'enslaves' individuals, representing the target of the 'offensive' magical work.

Crowley's Liber XXV, vel Cap. Stellae Rubeae, a Thelemic banishing and invocation ritual that forms a foundational daily practice in Panoptes' system, with a suggested substitution of 'Io Pan' for 'Hail Satan'.

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined is a method for proactive magical intervention against 'Slave Gods' and their perceived followers. It combines daily banishing/invocation rites (Star Ruby) with advanced visualization techniques to project an inverse pentagram onto targets, aiming to activate their 'third eye chakra'. This psychic projection is further amplified and energized through a specific sex magical rite involving karezza and the use of Tarot archetypes (Devil and Tower), with an option for sigil charging. The ultimate goal is to create a psychic link, raise the target's energy, and initiate them toward 'illumination' by disrupting their 'enslavement' to a 'Borg God'.
tools: Peter Carroll's Liber MMM from Liber Null and Psychonaut (for preliminary grounding)
Aleister Crowley's Magick : Liber Aba : Book 4 (for preliminary grounding)
Crowley's Book of Thoth : Tarot (specifically the Devil and Tower cards)
rituals: Daily performance of Crowley's Star Ruby rite (Liber XXV), with 'Hail Satan' as a possible substitute for 'Io Pan'.
Visualization and projection of an inverse pentagram from the practitioner's forehead to the target's forehead to initiate an 'offensive attack' (curse/blessing).

A sex magical rite to open the 'third eye': involves solitary masturbation or partnered anal intercourse (active partner associates with Tower, passive with Devil), gazing at the Tower card (equating symbology with procreative force), then switching to the Devil card (focusing on the third eye of the goat and assuming the 'Head of the Goat'). This involves 'karezza' (holding back orgasm) to build energy, visualizing and projecting the pentagram from the 'third eye'.
Optional: Charge a sigil with semen during the sex magical rite.

relevant_quotes.text: I will now describe what I do as an offensive in the battle against the Slave Gods.
To intiate an offensive attack -- which is actually a blessing in disguise -- you will imagine this inverse pentagram slightly between your eyebrows at the center of your forehead.
The key to the efficacy of this attack lies in the ability to open ones own 'third eye chakra' which provides the force behind the actual symbol.
This is a rite to cause change. It is only 'Black' in the sense that you are causing change to a weaker will whose objective is to enslave you to their particular Borg God.
Love is the law, love under will.

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is highly relevant for practitioners interested in proactive, 'offensive' magical strategies, particularly those with a gnostic or anti-theistic bent within modern occultism. It skillfully integrates elements of Thelemic ritual (Star Ruby), Chaos Magic principles (sigil charging, subjective interpretation), and sexual magic for a specific ideological goal: 'liberating' individuals from perceived 'Slave Gods' or 'Borg Gods'. Its emphasis on psychic projection and 'third eye' activation provides a distinct operational framework.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience is experienced occultists and magicians, ideally with a background in ceremonial magic (Thelema) and/or Chaos Magic. The text assumes familiarity with foundational texts (Crowley, Carroll) and comfort with explicit sexual magic, advanced visualization, and politically charged anti-authoritarian spiritual philosophies. It is explicitly not for magical beginners.
